alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Utah Valley (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 10:34PM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with locally higher amounts possible on the benches. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Wasatch Front, Salt Lake Valley and Utah Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday morning through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of lake effect snow are likely between Bountiful and the western Salt Lake Valley tonight into Friday, with locally heavy snow possible. Additionally, snow may mix with rain late Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov.

area.areaDesc: Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Utah Valley
